title: Persistent bottom-right photo frame after Yes + background music on intro interaction

requirements.summary: Show a small persistent bottom-right image frame (IMG_20221213_093702.jpg) after “Yes” is clicked, separate from the main card/button area.
acceptanceCriteria: Before “Yes” is clicked, no bottom-right image frame is visible.
Immediately after clicking “Yes”, a small frame appears at the bottom-right containing IMG_20221213_093702.jpg.
The frame remains visible until the page is reloaded (no timer-based dismissal).
The image frame is not rendered inside the main card’s button/message container; it is positioned independently (fixed bottom-right).
On mobile and desktop, the frame stays within the viewport (respects safe-area insets if applicable) and does not block the “Yes” click interaction.

file_operations.description: Add a dedicated, initially-hidden DOM container for the bottom-right image frame outside the main card, plus CSS for a fixed bottom-right layout that respects safe-area insets and uses pointer-events settings so it won’t block the “Yes” click. Update the existing “Yes” click handler to reveal the frame and keep it visible for the session.
Add the provided image asset to the static site so frontend/index.html can reference it via a stable relative path (no backend dependency).

requirements.summary: Play the uploaded “forever” song as background music starting only after the first explicit user interaction (intro/tap-to-start), and keep playing while the page is open.
acceptanceCriteria: Background music does not attempt to autoplay on page load (no browser autoplay violations).
After the user completes the first explicit interaction that starts the experience (intro/tap-to-start), the “forever” song begins playing as background music.
If the “forever” audio asset cannot be loaded for any reason, the page continues to function without crashing (graceful failure).

file_operations.description: Add an <audio> element (or programmatic Audio instance) configured for looping background playback and wire it to the existing intro/tap-to-start interaction so playback begins only after that user gesture. Ensure playback failures (e.g., load/play promise rejection) are caught and do not break the page flow.
Add the provided “forever” audio asset to the static site so frontend/index.html can load it locally without backend dependencies.
